channel.title: Posts on shark.exe
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on shark.exe

item.title: Prefetch Files
item.description: An analysis of Windows Prefetch files, their structure, forensic significance, and decompression process.

item.title: Windows Bigpools
item.description: An overview of how the Windows Kernel handles large memory allocations using BigPools, including internal structures and debugging techniques.

item.title: Windows Objects: Structure, Headers, and Internal Mechanics
item.description: A deep dive into Windows objects, focusing on their structure, headers, and relationships. This blog covers key components like _OBJECT_HEADER, OBJECT_TYPE, and ObTypeIndexTable, providing insights into how Windows organizes and references objects.

item.title: Application Crash Dump Analysis
item.description: This post explores application dumps, a crucial tool for debugging and analyzing software errors, offering insights into memory analysis and troubleshooting techniques

item.title: Kernel Memory Dump Analysis : Introduction
item.description: An introduction to analyzing kernel memory dumps using WinDbg.

item.title: Windows Shellcode Development & Debugging with WinDbg: A Hands-On Guide (Part 2)
item.description: A comprehensive guide to understanding and creating Windows shellcode from scratch for exploit development. This article includes practical insights into using WinDbg for effective debugging and analysis.

item.title: Windows Shellcode Development & Debugging with WinDbg: A Hands-On Guide (Part 1)
item.description: A comprehensive guide to understanding and creating Windows shellcode from scratch for exploit development. This article includes practical insights into using WinDbg for effective debugging and analysis.

item.title: PE Parsing: A Step-by-Step Guide with WinDbg - Part 2
item.description: Hands on parsing PE files with WinDbg and explore their structures for debugging and reverse engineering.

item.title: PE Parsing: A Step-by-Step Guide with WinDbg - Part 1
item.description: Hands on parsing PE files with WinDbg and explore their structures for debugging and reverse engineering.
